page.title: 12STREET GAMES
page.content: It is the custom in this part of the north of England for children to play 'out'.One child will call at the home of another to ask if he or she is coming to play outside.They will then call for more children until enough have been gathered to play a street game. Many street games are based on the game of 'Tig' and this,in its original form,is still played.Children have,however,made many of their own variations.Another favourite is 'Hide and Seek'.Once again,many changes have been made to make it a more challenging game. In some games,the whole width of a quiet street is used as the playing area.The object of these games is usually to get from one side of the street to the other,without being caught by the person who is 'on'.
